intro: Trichostema lanatum, commonly known as woolly bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland grasslands. Trichostema lanatum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance to pollinators.
